results.title: Sonatine
results.creator_credit: Shouchiku Daiichi Kougyo, Bandai Visual Company and Takeshi Kitano
results.brief_description: Like most Takeshi Kitano films, the body of this story is made up of the small details within the greater narrative, like the contemplative moments a couple shares, or the morbid retrospections before a bloody action shoot-out. The quiet observations momentarily disrupted by a sudden outburst of intense violence. In this glorious low tempo Yakuza film Kitano stars as a stoic gangster in desperate need of a holiday. When a ‘job’ goes wrong, Kitano and his gang are forced to retreat to a seaside hideaway. What follows is a series of beautifully observed deadpan scenes which constantly challenge our notions of what we have come to expect from the gangster genre. In Japanese with English subtitles. Cast includes Aya Kikumai, Tetsu Watanabe, Masanobu Katsumura, Sesumu Terajima and Ren Osugi.

results.title: Sonata in Brussels
results.brief_description: A portrait of life in a capital city. the noise of a crowd swarming around a city hotel is offset by the cooing of pigeons in the bird market; the mute dialogues in the parks, the clamour of the flea circus; the traffic jams, the whistle of the policeman which hypnotises the mannequins in a shop window; the cries of the street urchins; the music of the city. Without commentary.

results.title: Son of the ocean
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Suzanne Parker and Bob Kingsbury
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human Face of China”.
One of the grandest links in China’s network of waterways is the Yangtze River. The river was closed to foreigners in 1949. In this riverboat journey we travel through the Yangtze Gorges on the way from Chungking to Wuhan and the story of the boat crew and passengers unfolds. Narrated by John Bell. Contains Chinese language with English subtitles. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Son of Lassie
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Samuel Marx and S. Sylvan Simon
results.brief_description: Introduced by Bill Collins, “Son of Lassie” is a sequel to “Lassie come home”, based on some characters from the book “Lassie come home” by Eric Knight. It is set during World War II and tells the story of adventure and loyalty between man and dog - Ken (Peter Lawford) and Laddie, son of everyone’s favourite collie, Lassie. A classic family favourite with a cast including Donald Crisp, June Lockhart, Nigel Bruce.

results.title: Sommersby
results.creator_credit: Studio Canal+, Regency Enterprises, Alcor Films, Arnon Milchan and Jon Amiel
results.brief_description: People remembered Jack Sommersby as a bitter, loutish man but when he returns home after the Civil War, he’s tender, caring and resourceful. Has the war changed him… or is the man calling himself Jack Sommersby an impostor? Richard Gere and Jodie Foster are a match for the ages in Sommersby, a period romance rich in mystery, detail and splendid performances. They portray Jack and Laurel Sommersby, whose love grows as the suspicions about Jack mount. If he isn’t the man she married, Laurel knows he is the man she always wanted, but an ultimate test of their love and Jack’s identity awaits. Jack must stand trial for his life and the outcome makes for a memorable film.

results.title: Sommarnattens leende = Smiles of a summer night
results.brief_description:
At a turn-of-the-century midsummer’s night house party the eight main characters resolve themselves into four couples through a continually shifting kaleidoscope in which the changing relationships embody different attitudes to love. Stylisation of gesture, movement and composition is both gracefully balletic and atmospherically operatic, Mozartian in the balancing of sympathy and irony Stylistically the film reflects Bergman’s acknowledged discovery of Japanese director Mizoguchi’s atmospheric long shots. He was not particularly interested in psychological plausibility in providing explanation of the conditions that might make lasting love possible, a compromise between nature and social convention. Recalling Stiller’s Erotikon (1921), Bergman’s tragi-comedy has been compared with Renoir’s even more Mozartian ‘La Regle du Jeu’ and Ophuls’ bitter-sweet ‘La Ronde’. Also available on VHS.

Credits: Director, script, Ingmar Bergman ; photography, Gunnar Fischer ; music, Erik Nordgren ; editing, Oscar Roander.
Cast: Ulla Jacobsson, Eva Dalhbeck, Harriet Andersson, Margit Carlquist, Gunnar Bjornstrand, Jarl Kulle, Ake Fridell, Bjorn Bjelvenstam.

results.title: Sommaren med Monika = Summer with Monika
results.creator_credit: Svensk Filmindustri, Allan Ekelund and Ingmar Bergman
results.brief_description:
A chance meeting between Harry, an errand boy, and Monika, a wild and reckless young woman from the poorer quarter of Stockholm (a strikingly assured performance by Andersson), leads to an affair and an escape from the city for a holiday on the nearby islands. The summer idyll is abruptly shattered when Monika finds that she is pregnant. While Harry accepts the responsibilities of parenthood, Monika is less willing. The light and open space of the islands is contrasted with the dark claustrophobia of the city. Also available on VHS.

Credits: Producer, Allan Ekelund ; director, Ingmar Bergman ; writers, Ingmar Bergman, Per Anders Fogelstrom ; photography, Gunnar Fischer ; music, Erik Nordgren ; editors, Tage Holmberg, Gosta Lewin.
Cast: Harriet Andersson, Lars Ekborg.

results.title: Somewhere to go
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, John Morris and Brian Bergin
results.brief_description: Hugh Hudson, South Australian Minister for Education, discusses the establishment of school-based community centres in two Adelaide suburbs, Thebarton and Angle Park. The surveys and plans, initiated in mid 1973, show that an essential feature of the planning process was the participation of the communities concerned.

results.title: Somewhere in time
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Stephen Deutsch and Jeannot Szwarc
results.brief_description: A man is given an antique gold watch from an old woman who pleads with him to travel back in time with her. Years later, the man, Richard, is overwhelmed by a photograph of a beautiful woman. Seeing a picture of the woman in her later years, Richard realises that she is the same woman who gave him the watch, and that they had an affair the time the photo was taken. He becomes obsessed with returning to 1912 and being reunited with the young woman and is willing to sacrifice his life in the present to find happiness in the past. Cast includes Christopher Reeve, Jane Seymour, Christopher Plummer and Teresa Wright. Based on the novel “Bid time return” by Richard Matheson.
